Methods of Analysisa These will be worked out, on the basis of
standard IBM type compilations wherever possible, and checked by
the research advisors of this project (as mentioned above).
Approximate time schedule. The entire project is tailored for
completion in two years. The first year will be devoted to
experimentation as outlined above. Most of the second year will be
devoted to preparing and testing the finished grammars for compre¬
hension and instructional practicability and applicability, and
finalizing reports. An interim report will be made at the end of
the first year.
Expected end-product. As outlined under Objectives, one or
several publications, for use, in teacher training courses, and
eventually in media courses in the schools of the U, S. and else¬
where, The ultimate objectives are l) better teaching and 2) better
understanding of media in all situations by children as learners,
and eventually as adults.
The CBC in Toronto has offered to script, cast and produce
many sections of the text as it is written. They will broadcast
those programs which require actual broadcast, and have offered
their distinguished research division to test reactions which can
be used as a basis of improvement of the text. Kinescopes and/or
videotapes of those programs will also be made available by them
for use in other locations throughout the continent. These materials
as well as the text, or alternatively several smaller handbooks or
"grammars” of the media, will be made available to 17. S. education
